item.title: Mecha Break's Next Open Beta Lets Players Try Its Extraction Mode For The First Time
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/mecha-breaks-next-open-beta-lets-players-try-its-extraction-mode-for-the-first-time/1100-6529488/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazing Seasun has confirmed that an open beta for its multiplayer mecha shooter Mecha Break will begin on February 23. It will be the most comprehensive one for the game yet, featuring most of what players can expect in Mecha Break at release.

The Global Storm Open Beta begins at 2 AM PT / 5 AM PT on February 23, while no end date has been confirmed yet. Global Storm will contain the 6v6 Operation Verge and 3v3 Ace Arena modes that have been in previous Mecha Break betas, but it will be the first to feature full cross-play across PC and console and include Mashmak. Mashmak is Mecha Break's PvPvE extraction mode, where teams of players work together or fight each other over an element called Corite.

Mashmak gets its name from the map on which this mode takes place. An evil organization called Theia's Vanguard has taken over the Mashmak Isles and its massive supply of Corite. That serves as the narrative backdrop for why players explore, collect resources, and fight each other before extracting. From a gameplay perspective, Mashmak stands out because players can equip themselves with special mode-exclusive equipment to enhance their suits' abilities.

Mecha Break will launch for PC and Xbox Series X|S sometime in Spring 2025 before coming to other platforms later in the year. The PC version of this open beta can be pre-loaded on Steam from 2 AM PT / 5 AM ET on February 20.

Tomas Franzese on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Astro Bot Gets PS5 Pro Support And New Levels Starting Today
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/astro-bot-gets-ps5-pro-support-and-new-levels-starting-today/1100-6529484/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation has announced that PS5 Pro support has been added to Astro Bot, and the first of five additional levels is live in the game today.

According to the PlayStation Blog, the PS5 Pro support comes with a constant resolution boost while still running at 60fps. The first of the five new levels will be added today, which is Tick-Tock Shock. The remaining ones will release weekly on Thursdays at 6 AM PT / 9 AM ET. Thrust or Bust will release on February 20, Cock-A-Doodle-Doom on February 27, Hard to Bear on March 6, and Armored Hardcore on March 13.

These levels are harder than the ones introduced in Astro Bot's previous update, Winter Wonder. They'll also have a new bot to rescue and can be replayed in Time Attack mode with online rankings. Players will also have had to completed the main game to access these new levels.

Astro Bot was one of Gamespot's best games of 2024, and it won the coveted Game of the Year award at The Game Awards 2024. It was also nominated in plenty of other awards shows too, including New York Game Awards 2025, 28th annual DICE Awards, and the Game Developers Choice Awards 2025. Sony is reportedly creating a new PS5 bundle that includes a copy of Astro Bot as well.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater On Xbox Crosses Over With A Surprise Konami Franchise
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/metal-gear-solid-delta-snake-eater-on-xbox-crosses-over-with-a-surprise-konami-franchise/1100-6529482/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During February 12's State of Play, Konami confirmed an August 28 release date for Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater and teased that the Snake vs. Monkey crossover mode with Ape Escape would return on PS5. You may have missed that Xbox players will be getting a different crossover.

It looks like Xbox players can expect Snake to face off with Bomberman. Konami and Microsoft released a dedicated release date trailer for the Xbox version of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater shortly after the State of Play. In lieu of the shot teasing the Ape Escape collaboration, the Xbox trailer instead plays the iconic "alert" Metal Gear sound effect over an exclamation point. The square serving as the point on that punctuation then unfolds to reveal a cartoonish bomb, which then blows up and shows a camouflage version of Bomberman with the text "Snake vs. ???" overlayed.

While Konami isn't saying anything more about this special mode at this time, it's clear that this is a collaboration with another one of Konami's biggest franchises. Bomberman predates Metal Gear, as Hudson Soft created it in 1983. Konami has owned Bomberman since it acquired Hudson Soft in 2011 and developed new games in the series, like Super Bomberman R and its sequel.

The top-down bomb-laying and maze-navigating gameplay of Bomberman is quite different from the hardcore action of Metal Gear, so we aren't sure how Konami will combine the two gameplay styles into a special mode just yet. The Ape Escape mode on PlayStation is expected to be similar to the Snake vs. Monkey mode that appeared in the original PS2 release of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater launches for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S on August 28. It's now available for preorder, with the $80 Digital Deluxe Edition granted 48 hours of early access to the game.

Tomas Franzese on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
